definitions_glossary.cardiopulmonary_bypass: Machine that takes over heart and lung function during surgery
definitions_glossary.deep_hypothermic_circulatory_arrest: Cooling body to allow brief complete cessation of circulation for arch work
definitions_glossary.bentall_procedure: Composite replacement of aortic valve, root, and ascending aorta
definitions_glossary.antegrade_cerebral_perfusion: Selective brain perfusion during circulatory arrest
definitions_glossary.hemiarch_replacement: Replacement of underside of arch without full arch replacement

surgical_goals: Prevent stroke from arch vessel involvement

ascending_only.indication: Entry tear in ascending, competent valve, no arch involvement

root_involvement.indication: Root dilation, valve regurgitation, coronary involvement

arch_involvement.indication: Tear in arch, arch vessel dissection
options: Total arch with frozen elephant trunk

prefLabel.@value: Type A Aortic Dissection Surgical Management

definition.@value: Emergency surgical repair of Type A aortic dissection involving ascending aortic replacement

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Explain why Type A requires emergency surgery
clinical_pearls: Don't delay surgery waiting for optimization - OR is the resuscitation
Hourly mortality 1-2% in first 48 hours - time = survival
Axillary artery preferred cannulation site - avoids dissected aorta
Volume and experience matter enormously for outcomes
